result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendall James McClure was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; The first 3 months shall be served with Huber privileges to apply for work and treatment, and the last 6 months shall have Huber privileges for work and treatment with release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring, if deemed appropriate by DOC

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all costs, fees and assessments. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin DOC's.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- Attend the following programs and/or assessments: AODA.
- Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by Agent.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Undergo random urine screens.
- No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- No contact with drug users, dealers or drug houses without approval of the Court.
- Obtain/maintain employment, if possible.
- Cooperate with Cognitive Thinking/Behavioral Modification Therapy.

timeConds.notes: FORTHWITH with release privileges for treatment

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendall James McClure

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kendall James McClure in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the Court.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  The first 3 months shall be served with huber privileges to apply for work and treatment, and the last 6 months shall have huber privileges for work and treatment with release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring, if deemed appropriate by DOC; credit for 2 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH with release privileges for treatment.
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA.
- Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Undergo random urine screens.
-  No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- No contact with drug users, dealers or drug houses without approval of the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment, if possible.
- Cooperate with Cognitive Thinking/Behavioral Modification Therapy.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
- Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed; copy to defendant.

Defendant Kendall James McClure in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kendall James McClure in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 5/7/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kendall James McClure in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Kendall James McClure in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
